jobPostingInfo.title: Administrative Liaison III
jobPostingInfo.jobDescription:
Job Details

New ideas are all around us, but only a few will change the world. That’s our focus at JPL. We ask the biggest questions, then search the universe for answers—literally. We build upon ideas that have guided generations, then share our discoveries to inspire generations to come. Your mission—your opportunity—is to seek out the answers that bring us one step closer. If you’re driven to discover, create, and inspire something that lasts a lifetime and beyond, you’re ready for JPL.

Located in Pasadena, California, JPL has a campus-like environment situated on 177 acres in the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains and offers a work environment unlike any other: we inspire passion, foster innovation, build collaboration, and reward excellence.

Responsibilities:

The Administrative Liaison III position is an outstanding opportunity to be part of JPL's Autonomous Systems Division. Our division is responsible for technology, advanced concepts, design, development, delivery, integration & test, verification & validation, operation of hardware, flight software, power systems, robotic systems, and Guidance & Control of a multitude of JPL products.

We are looking for a motivated and dedicated Administrative Liaison, to join our team within the Business Administration Section. You will report to the Business Administration Manager.

Tasks include but not limited to:

  • Perform moderately complex job functions and activities to assist, coordinate and perform aspects of acquisitions, facilities, logistics, safety and property for the Mobility and Robotics Section. This is primarily a logistical and project support position with other duties performed as required.

  • Work with requestors to develop procurement requisitions for both flight and non-flight, standard and specialized materials, supplies, services, and equipment.

  • Process and monitor all requisitions, confirmations and supplier changes and will follow up customer service issues and order discrepancies to resolution.

  • Confer with vendors to obtain product or service information such as price, availability, delivery schedule, etc. and may negotiate pricing for one-time items.

  • Arrange urgent shipment when necessary in collaboration with JPL’s logistics group to meet project schedules.

  • Assist in developing strong relationships with vendors to help ensure JPL is receiving competitive quotes and will help to identify cost improvements and alternative sourcing options to help implement savings for JPL

  • Help monitor suppliers’ performance and will help to analyze and recommend best overall vendors for specific purchases.

  • May assist technical personnel in administering contracts and prepare justification memos for non-competitive procurements.

  • May assist project personnel in tracking requisitions as related to cost and schedule implication on the project.

  • Develop and maintain filing systems sufficient to support procurement policies and procedures.

Other duties may include processing requests for office and/or technical facilities and processing paperwork for surplus equipment and missing property.  May scan inventory items, perform safety walkthroughs and work with the property or safety representative to ensure property and facilities meets security and safety requirements. Process standard shippers for transporting equipment.

Qualifications:

  • Typically requires a High School diploma with a minimum of 8 years of related experience or Associates degree with a minimum of 4 year of related experience or a Bachelor’s degree with a minimum of 1 year of related experience and related required training.

  • Must be detail-oriented with strong planning, organizational, problem solving and analytical skills.

  • Must be flexible with ability to prioritize tasks in a dynamic team environment under minimal supervision.

  • Must possess outstanding customer service and communication skills and have excellent written and oral communications skills.

  • Requires an advanced understanding of both general and detailed job aspects and details, as well as the ability to apply strong problem-solving skills as needed on an ongoing basis.

  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite required.

  • Willingness to learn new technologies and tools to enhance and/or improve office processes.

  • Motivated self-starter who takes the initiative to perform activities and resolve unusual or nonstandard problems.

Preferred Skills:

  • Knowledge of JPL/ESD policies, procedures, and practices

  • Subject Matter Expert (SME) in acquisitions, logistics, facilities, safety and property.

  • Experience using JPL-based tools such as Service Order Modules, Requisitions, P-card, WAMs, Property Manager Gateway Administrator, and JPL Web Assets.

  • Some familiarity of JPL reporting tools such as Data Extractor, JEMS and OBIEE/EBIS Business Reporting

JPL has a catalog of benefits and perks that span from the traditional to the unique. This includes a variety of health, dental, vision, wellbeing, and retirement plans, paid time off, learning, rideshare, childcare, flexible schedule, parental leave and many more. Our focus is on work-life balance, and living healthy, fulfilling lives as we Dare Mighty Things Together. For benefits eligible positions, benefits are effective the first day of the month coincident with or immediately following the employee’s start date.

For further benefits information click Benefits and Perks

The hiring range displayed below is specifically for those who will work in or reside in the location listed. In extending an offer, Jet Propulsion Laboratory considers factors including, but not limited to, the candidate’s job related skills, experience, knowledge, and relevant education/training. Hiring range for this job may be adjusted based on primary work location outside of Pasadena, California. This adjusted range will be provided to candidates by the Recruiter when applicable.

The typical full time equivalent annual hiring range for this job in Pasadena, California.

$67,600 - $89,232

JPL is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, color, religion, national origin, citizenship, ancestry, age, marital status, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, pregnancy or perceived pregnancy, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, protected military or veteran status or any other characteristic or condition protected by Federal, state or local law.

In addition, JPL is a VEVRAA Federal Contractor.

EEO is the Law.

EEO is the Law Supplement

Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision

The Jet Propulsion Laboratory is a federal facility. Due to rules imposed by NASA, JPL will not accept applications from citizens of designated countries or those born in a designated country unless they are Legal Permanent Residents of the U.S or have other protected status under 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3). The Designated Countries List is available here.
